name: pure-storage-flasharray
label: Pure Storage FlashArray
description: Pure Storage is a leading provider of enterprise data storage solutions. It is specialize in all-flash storage arrays, delivering high-performance, reliable, and scalable storage solutions for businesses. With Pure Storage FlashArray, organizations can accelerate applications, improve productivity, and make data-driven decisions. Experience the power of next-generation storage technology with Pure Storage FlashArray.

fields.name: server_url
fields.title: Server URL
fields.tooltip: Specify the server name or IP address to connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.description: Specify the server name or IP address to connect and perform the automated operations. By default, it is set to https://api.pure1.purestorage.com.

fields.name: iss
fields.title: Issuer
fields.tooltip: Specify the application ID for the Pure1 or API client's trusted identity issuer on the array.
fields.description: Specify the application ID for the Pure1 or API client's trusted identity issuer on the array.

fields.name: sub
fields.title: User Name
fields.tooltip: Specify the login name of the array user for whom the token should be issued. This must be a valid user in the system.
fields.description: Specify the login name of the array user for whom the token should be issued. This must be a valid user in the system.

fields.name: aud
fields.title: Client ID
fields.tooltip: Specify the client ID of the API client that issues the identity token.
fields.description: Specify the client ID of the API client that issues the identity token.

fields.name: kid
fields.title: Key ID
fields.tooltip: Specify the Key ID of the API client that issues the identity token.
fields.description: Specify the Key ID of the API client that issues the identity token.

fields.name: private_key_type
fields.title: Private Key Type
fields.tooltip: Specify the private key type paired with the API client's public key.
fields.description: Specify the private key type paired with the API client's public key. You can choose from the following options: Encrypted Not Encrypted

Encrypted.name: private_key
Encrypted.title: Private Key
Encrypted.tooltip: Specify the private key which is paired with the API client's public key.
Encrypted.description: Specify the private key which is paired with the API client's public key.

Encrypted.name: passphrase
Encrypted.title: Passphrase
Encrypted.tooltip: Specify the passphrase for the private key paired with the API client's public key.
Encrypted.description: Specify the passphrase for the private key paired with the API client's public key.

Not Encrypted.name: private_key
Not Encrypted.title: Private Key
Not Encrypted.tooltip: Specify the private key which is paired with the API client's public key.
Not Encrypted.description: Specify the private key which is paired with the API client's public key.

fields.name: api_version
fields.title: API Version
fields.tooltip: Specify the API version of the Pure Storage FlashArray.
fields.description: (Optional) Specify the API version of the Pure Storage FlashArray. By default it is set to 2.23.

fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.tooltip: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified.
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified. By default, this option is set to True.

operations.title: Get Alert List
operations.description: Retrieves information about alerts generated on FlashArray. Alerts indicate significant events occurring on an array.

parameters.name: based_on
parameters.title: Based on
parameters.tooltip: Select the parameter using which to retrieve alerts from Pure Storage.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the parameter using which to retrieve alerts from Pure Storage. You can choose from the following options: Alert IDs, Alert Names

Alert IDs.name: ids
Alert IDs.title: Alert IDs
Alert IDs.tooltip: Specify comma-separated alert IDs to retrieve the corresponding alerts in the Alert IDs field. An error is returned if no resource matches an ID element.
Alert IDs.description: Specify comma-separated alert IDs to retrieve the corresponding alerts in the Alert IDs field. An error is returned if no resource matches an ID element.

Alert Names.name: names
Alert Names.title: Alert Names
Alert Names.tooltip: Specify the comma-separated alert names to retrieve the corresponding alerts in the Alert Names field. An error is returned if no resource matches a name element.
Alert Names.description: Specify the comma-separated alert names to retrieve the corresponding alerts in the Alert Names field. An error is returned if no resource matches a name element.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.title: Filter Query
parameters.tooltip: Specify the filter criteria to retrieve required alerts. Single quotes are required around all strings inside the filters.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the filter criteria to retrieve required alerts. All strings within the query must be enclosed within single quotes ('). For example: id='alert_id' and state='closed'.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.title: Sort Fields
parameters.tooltip: Specify the sorting criterion to sort the alerts. To sort in descending order, append '-' to the field name. For example: id, name- NOTE: If you provide a sort criterion you do not get a continuation token in the response.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the sorting criterion to sort the alerts. To sort in descending order, append '-' to the field name. For example: id, name- NOTE: If you provide a sort criterion you do not get a continuation token in the response.

parameters.name: flagged
parameters.title: Flagged
parameters.tooltip: Select whether to retrieve flagged, unflagged, or all alerts. If not specified, lists all alerts.
parameters.description: Select whether to retrieve flagged, unflagged, or all alerts. You can select from the the following options: True: Select to retrieve only flagged alerts. False: Select to retrieve only unflagged alerts. To retrieve all alerts, leave the field blank.

parameters.name: total_item_count
parameters.title: Total Count
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to get a total count of items that match the specified query parameters. Leaving this option unchecked may speed up queries where the total item count is large.
parameters.description: Select this option to get a total count of items that match the specified query parameters. Leaving this option unchecked may speed up queries where the total item count is large. By default, this option is not selected.

parameters.name: continuation_token
parameters.title: Continuation Token
parameters.tooltip: Specify a continuation token, returned in the continuation_token field of a request, to iterate on collection.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a continuation token, returned in the continuation_token field of a request, to iterate on collection.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.title: Offset
parameters.tooltip: Specify the count of records to skip when retrieving records using this operation.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the count of records to skip when retrieving records using this operation.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.title: Limit
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of records that this operation should return. By default it returns 1000 records.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of records that this operation should return. By default it returns 1000 records.

operations.title: Get Array List
operations.description: Retrieves information about FlashArray storage appliances from Pure Storage.

parameters.name: based_on
parameters.title: Based on
parameters.tooltip: Select the parameter using which to retrieve arrays from Pure Storage.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the parameter using which to retrieve arrays from Pure Storage. You can choose from the following options: Array IDs, Array Names

Array IDs.name: ids
Array IDs.title: Array IDs
Array IDs.tooltip: Specify comma-separated array IDs to retrieve the corresponding arrays in the Array IDs field. An error is returned if no resource matches an ID element.
Array IDs.description: Specify comma-separated array IDs to retrieve the corresponding arrays in the Array IDs field. An error is returned if no resource matches an ID element.

Array Names.name: names
Array Names.title: Array Names

Array Names.description: Specify the comma-separated array names to retrieve the corresponding arrays in the Array Names field. An error is returned if no resource matches a name element.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.title: Filter Query
parameters.tooltip: Specify the filter criteria to retrieve required arrays. All strings within the query must be enclosed within single quotes (').
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the filter criteria to retrieve required arrays. All strings within the query must be enclosed within single quotes ('). For example: os='os_1' and purity='1.0'.

parameters.name: fqdns
parameters.title: FQDNs
parameters.tooltip: Specify the comma-separated resource FQDNs. If there is not at least one resource that matches each fqdn element, an error is returned.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the comma-separated resource FQDNs. An error is returned if no resource matches an FQDN element.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.title: Sort Fields
parameters.tooltip: Specify the sorting criterion to sort the arrays. To sort in descending order, append '-' to the field name. NOTE: If you provide a sort criterion you do not get a continuation token in the response.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the sorting criterion to sort the arrays. To sort in descending order, append '-' to the field name. For example: space.total_provisioned, id- NOTE: If you provide a sort criterion you do not get a continuation token in the response.

parameters.name: total_item_count
parameters.title: Total Count
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to get a total count of items that match the specified query parameters. Leaving this option unchecked may speed up queries where the total item count is large.
parameters.description: Select this option to get a total count of items that match the specified query parameters. Leaving this option unchecked may speed up queries where the total item count is large. By default, this option is not selected.

parameters.name: continuation_token
parameters.title: Continuation Token
parameters.tooltip: Specify a continuation token, returned in the continuation_token field of a request, to iterate on collection.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a continuation token, returned in the continuation_token field of a request, to iterate on collection.

parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of records that this operation should return. By default it returns 1000 records.

parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the sorting criterion to sort the controller. To sort in descending order, append '-' to the field name. For example: status-, name NOTE: If you provide a sort criterion you do not get a continuation token in the response.

operations.title: Get Directory List
operations.description: Retrieves information about FlashArray managed directory objects from Pure Storage.

parameters.name: based_on

parameters.tooltip: Select the parameter using which to retrieve directories from Pure Storage.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the parameter using which to retrieve directories from Pure Storage. You can choose from the following options: Directory IDs, Directory Names

Directory IDs.name: ids
Directory IDs.title: Directory IDs
Directory IDs.tooltip: Specify comma-separated directory IDs to retrieve the corresponding directories in the Directory IDs field. An error is returned if no resource matches an ID element.
Directory IDs.description: Specify comma-separated directory IDs to retrieve the corresponding directories in the Directory IDs field. An error is returned if no resource matches an ID element.

Directory Names.name: names

Directory Names.tooltip: Specify the comma-separated directory names to retrieve the corresponding directories in the Directory Names field. An error is returned if no resource matches a name element.
Directory Names.description: Specify the comma-separated directory names to retrieve the corresponding directories in the Directory Names field. An error is returned if no resource matches a name element.

parameters.name: filesystem_filter
parameters.title: File System Filter
parameters.tooltip: Select the parameter using which to retrieve directories from Pure Storage.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the parameter using which to retrieve directories from Pure Storage. You can choose from the following options: File System IDs, File System Names.

File System IDs.name: file_system_ids
File System IDs.title: File System IDs
File System IDs.tooltip: Specify comma-separated file system IDs to retrieve the corresponding directories in the File System IDs field.
File System IDs.description: Specify comma-separated file system IDs to retrieve the corresponding directories in the File System IDs field. For example file_system_id1, file_system_id2.

File System Names.name: file_system_names
File System Names.title: File System Names
File System Names.tooltip: Specify the comma-separated file system names to retrieve the corresponding directories in the Directory Names field.
File System Names.description: Specify the comma-separated file system names to retrieve the corresponding directories in the Directory Names field. For example filesystem1, filesystem2.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.title: Filter Query
parameters.tooltip: Specify the filter criteria to retrieve required directories. All strings within the query must be enclosed within single quotes (').
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the filter criteria to retrieve required directories. All strings within the query must be enclosed within single quotes (').

parameters.name: sort
parameters.title: Sort Fields
parameters.tooltip: Specify the sorting criterion to sort the directories. To sort in descending order, append '-' to the field name. NOTE: If you provide a sort criterion you do not get a continuation token in the response.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the sorting criterion to sort the directories. To sort in descending order, append '-' to the field name. For example: status-, name NOTE: If you provide a sort criterion you do not get a continuation token in the response.

parameters.name: destroyed
parameters.title: Destroyed
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to list only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. Leaving this option unchecked lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds.
parameters.description: Select this option to list only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. Leaving this option unchecked lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds.

parameters.name: total_item_count
parameters.title: Total Count
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to get a total count of items that match the specified query parameters. Leaving this option unchecked may speed up queries where the total item count is large.
parameters.description: Select this option to get a total count of items that match the specified query parameters. Leaving this option unchecked may speed up queries where the total item count is large. By default, this option is not selected.

parameters.name: total_only
parameters.title: Total Only
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to get the aggregate value of all items after filtering. Where it makes more sense, the average value is displayed instead. The values are displayed for each name where meaningful. If selected, the returned items list is empty.
parameters.description: Select this option to get the aggregate value of all items after filtering. Where it makes more sense, the average value is displayed instead. The values are displayed for each name where meaningful. If selected, the returned items list is empty. By default, this option is not selected.

operations.title: Get Protection Group List
operations.description: Retrieves a list of protection groups, including their associated source arrays, replication targets, hosts, host groups, and volumes from Pure Storage. The list includes protection groups that were created on the local array to replicate snapshot data to other arrays or offload targets, created on a remote array and replicated asynchronously to this array, or created inside a pod on a remote array and stretched to the local array.

parameters.name: names
parameters.title: Protection Group Names
parameters.tooltip: Specify comma-separated protection group names to retrieve the corresponding protection groups. An error is returned if no resource matches a name element.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify comma-separated protection group names to retrieve the corresponding protection groups. An error is returned if no resource matches a name element.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.title: Filter Query
parameters.tooltip: Specify the filter criteria to retrieve required protection groups. All strings within the query must be enclosed within single quotes (').
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the filter criteria to retrieve required protection groups. All strings within the query must be enclosed within single quotes ('). For example: eradication_config.manual_eradication!='enabled' or pod.name='pod1'.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.title: Sort Fields
parameters.tooltip: Specify the sorting criterion to sort the volumes. To sort in descending order, append '-' to the field name. NOTE: If you provide a sort criterion you do not get a continuation token in the response.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the sorting criterion to sort the volumes. To sort in descending order, append '-' to the field name. For example: space.snapshots-, name NOTE: If you provide a sort criterion you do not get a continuation token in the response.

operations.title: Get Session List
operations.description: Retrieves information about session for user login events performed in the Purity//FA GUI, CLI, and REST API.

parameters.name: based_on
parameters.title: Based on
parameters.tooltip: Select the parameter using which to retrieve session from Pure Storage.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the parameter using which to retrieve session from Pure Storage. You can choose from the following options: Session IDs, Session Names

Session IDs.name: ids
Session IDs.title: Session IDs
Session IDs.tooltip: Specify comma-separated session IDs to retrieve the corresponding session in the Session IDs field. An error is returned if no resource matches an ID element.
Session IDs.description: Specify comma-separated session IDs to retrieve the corresponding session in the Session IDs field. An error is returned if no resource matches an ID element.

Session Names.name: names
Session Names.title: Session Names
Session Names.tooltip: Specify the comma-separated session names to retrieve the corresponding session in the Session Names field. An error is returned if no resource matches a name element.
Session Names.description: Specify the comma-separated session names to retrieve the corresponding session in the Session Names field. An error is returned if no resource matches a name element.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.title: Filter Query
parameters.tooltip: Specify the filter criteria to retrieve required volumes. All strings within the query must be enclosed within single quotes (').
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the filter criteria to retrieve required volumes. All strings within the query must be enclosed within single quotes ('). For example event='failed authentication' and event_count>3

parameters.name: sort
parameters.title: Sort Fields
parameters.tooltip: Specify the sorting criterion to sort sessions. To sort in descending order, append '-' to the field name. NOTE: If you provide a sort criterion you do not get a continuation token in the response.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the sorting criterion to sort sessions. To sort in descending order, append '-' to the field name. For example: event_count-, end_time- NOTE: If you provide a sort criterion you do not get a continuation token in the response.

parameters.name: total_item_count
parameters.title: Total Count
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to get a total count of items that match the specified query parameters. Leaving this option unchecked may speed up queries where the total item count is large.
parameters.description: Select this option to get a total count of items that match the specified query parameters. Leaving this option unchecked may speed up queries where the total item count is large. By default, this option is not selected.

parameters.name: continuation_token
parameters.title: Continuation Token
parameters.tooltip: Specify a continuation token, returned in the continuation_token field of a request, to iterate on collection.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a continuation token, returned in the continuation_token field of a request, to iterate on collection.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.title: Offset
parameters.tooltip: Specify the count of records to skip when retrieving records using this operation.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the count of records to skip when retrieving records using this operation.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.title: Limit
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of records that this operation should return. By default it returns 1000 records.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of records that this operation should return. By default it returns 1000 records.
